Functional Programming

Pure Functions

Pure functions are functions that will get the same return value given the same inputs.

for example:

  function square(a) {
    return a ** 2
  }

If we call square(2) we will always get back 4. Pure functions are easily testable because they donâ€™t require any dependencies and we can just throw things into the input and test the output with very low overhead.
